message.content: Factoring $(2x+3)(x-4)$ out of each term in the equation, we get $(2x+3)(x-4)+(2x+3)(x-6) = (2x+3)(x-4+x-6)$. Simplifying, we have $(2x+3)(2x-10)$.  Since $(2x+3)(2x-10)=0$, we have $2x+3=0$ or $2x-10=0$.  Solving the first equation gives $x=\boxed{-\frac32}$, and solving the second equation gives $x=\boxed{5}$.  Therefore, the sum of all the roots is $-\frac32+5=\boxed{\frac52}$.
